title: Stefon Diggs hopes Super Bowl LX can strengthen Hall of Fame case. Would a win put Patriots’ WR in Canton?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Stefon Diggs is aiming for a Hall of Fame career, seeking to solidify his legacy with a Super Bowl win.
Diggs has been named to the Pro Bowl four times and has two All-Pro honors in his career.
A Super Bowl victory and MVP award would enhance Diggs's hall credentials, though further achievements are needed.

title: Would the Patriots’ dynasty have ever happened without new Hall of Famer Adam Vinatieri?
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Adam Vinatieri named to Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2026, played 24 NFL seasons with Patriots and Colts.
Vinatieri's 45-yard tying field goal against Raiders in 2002 considered a key moment in Patriots' Super Bowl era.
He holds NFL record for most points scored (2,673) and made two Super Bowl-winning field goals with Patriots.

title: Mike Vrabel throws a wrinkle in Patriots’ final practice ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel had Patriots simulate the extended Super Bowl halftime during their final practice at Stanford Stadium.
Key players Harold Landry III and Robert Spillane were limited in practice due to knee and ankle injuries.
Patriots' Drayke Maye participated fully despite a shoulder issue, staying late with teammates for extra practice.

title: Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl will likely come down to which quarterback makes the fewest mistakes
author: Chad Finn
bullets: The Patriots and Seahawks will face off in Super Bowl LX with quarterbacks Drake Maye and Sam Darnold crucial to the outcome.
Drake Maye led the Patriots through three top-five defenses, while Sam Darnold has yet to commit a postseason turnover for the Seahawks.
Defensive tackle Milton Williams is key for the Patriots, aiming to pressure Darnold and halt the Seahawks' running game.

title: Mass. company pleads guilty to OSHA violation that led to employee’s death
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: John Oliveira & Sons Stamp Concrete, Inc. pleaded guilty to OSHA violations in an incident that killed employee Josué Tiquiram.
The employee died in September 2023 when a heavy machine's tail conveyor closed on his head due to equipment malfunction.
The company faces up to five years of probation, a $500,000 fine, and restitution, with sentencing set for May 4.

title: Here’s what Healey put up in her Super Bowl bet with Washington state governor
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey bet Seattle's Governor Bob Ferguson seafood and Dunkin' coffee for the Super Bowl.
Healey's wager includes clam chowder, lobster rolls, and oysters, referencing New England's 2015 win over Seattle.
In return, Ferguson will provide shellfish and coffee if the Patriots win against the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.

title: Woman convicted of fraud after living under a stolen identity for more than 20 years
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Lina Maria Orovio-Hernandez, 59, was convicted in Boston for identity theft, voter fraud, and using a stolen Social Security number.
She fraudulently obtained over $400,000 in federal benefits and applied for a U.S. passport with false information.
Orovio-Hernandez faces up to 10 years in prison, fines, and deportation after serving her sentence.

title: Celtics rally from 22 down in Vucevic’s debut to beat Heat: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds in his Boston Celtics debut, aiding a 98-96 victory over Miami Heat.
The Celtics overcame a 21-point halftime deficit against the Heat, thanks to a strong second half led by Jaylen Brown and Derrick White.
Payton Pritchard sparked the Celtics' comeback with 19 points, including crucial baskets during a back-and-forth duel with Norman Powell.

title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't rooting for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, citing no allegiance in the game.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft on Instagram, encouraging the team to win their 7th ring.
Former teammates criticized Brady's neutral comments, sharing their disappointment over his lack of public support for the Patriots.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Jeff Saturday and Mina Kimes argue Drake Maye was more deserving of NFL MVP than winner Matthew Stafford.
Drake Maye had a QBR of 81.4 against common opponents, compared to Matthew Stafford's 57.8.
Stafford led the league with 4,707 passing yards, but Maye was noted for dual-threat play and efficiency.
